text.text_translated: Graffiti is writing or pictures painted on walls and buildings, and people often ask if it is art or vandalism. Vandalism is the crime of breaking property that doesn't belong to you. The answer depends on your opinion, but in many countries, it is considered vandalism when people write or paint on public or private property. Because of this, many street artists have been caught by the police, and some have had to pay money as a punishment. In addition, city governments often complain about how much it costs to clean the graffiti from buildings, buses and trains.
